Artefact.Name: Sword of Striking
Artefact.Description: +1 to Hit

Artefact.Name: Sword of Battle
Artefact.Description: +1 Attack

Artefact.Name: Sword of Might
Artefact.Description: +1 Strength

Artefact.Name: Biting Blade
Artefact.Description: -1 armour save

Artefact.Name: Enchanted shield
Artefact.Description: 5+ armour save

Artefact.Name: Talisman of Protection
Artefact.Description: 6+ ward save

Artefact.Name: Dispell Scroll
Artefact.Description: automatically dispel an enemy spell, one use only

Artefact.Name: Power Stone
Artefact.Description: +2 dice to cast a spell

Artefact.Name: Staff of Sorcery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to dispel
Artefact.Description: +1 to dispel

Artefact.Name: War Banner
Artefact.Description: +1 Combat Resolution

Artefact.Name: Runefang
Artefact.Description: All hits from a Runefang wound automatically. No armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: The Mace of Helsturm
Artefact.Description: The bearer can forfeit all of his normal Attacks to make only one Attack. Roll to hit normally. If this one Attack hits, the hit is resolved at Strength 10 and causes D6 wounds.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Fate
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: At the beginning of the battle, nominate one enemy character or monster. The sword counts as a magic sword with no particular bonuses against any other opponent, but attacks directed against the designated target will wound it on a 2+ and cause D3 wounds, with no armour saves allowed
Artefact.Description: At the beginning of the battle, nominate one enemy character or monster. The sword counts as a magic sword with no particular bonuses against any other opponent, but attacks directed against the designated target will wound it on a 2+ and cause D3 wounds, with no armour saves allowed.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Sigismund
Artefact.Description: The wielder of this sword has +1 Strength and always strikes first in close combat, even before enemies that have charged. If the bearer is fighting another enemy who is also entitled to strike first (because of spells, special abilities, etc), then resolve attacks in Initiative order. If Initiative values are equal, roll a dice to determine who strikes first.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Righteous Steel
Artefact.Description: The wielder always hits any opponent on a 2+, regardless of relative Weapon Skills. This cannot be modified in any way.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Power
Artefact.Description: The sword confers +2 Strength to all close combat attacks made by the character fighting with it.

Artefact.Name: Hammer of Judgement
Artefact.Description: Models hit by this hammer must take a Leadership test for every hit suffered. If the test is failed, the hit wounds automatically and no armour save is allowed. If the test is passed, roll to wound and take armour saves as normal.

Artefact.Name: Dragon Bow
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The Dragon Bow has a range of 36" and Strength 6. Any hits from this bow count as being from a magical weapon
Artefact.Description: The Dragon Bow has a range of 36" and Strength 6. Any hits from this bow count as being from a magical weapon.

Artefact.Name: Sword of Justice
Artefact.Description: The bearer can re-roll To Wound failed rolls.

Artefact.Name: Wyrmslayer Sword
Artefact.Description: Hits from this sword wound any opponent on a roll of 4+ (unless the wielder's Strength would make this less). Armour saves apply as normal, modified by the Strength of the character, but Large Targets lose their armour save due to the scaly skin special rule against hits from this sword.

Artefact.Name: The Gilded Armour
Artefact.Description: Counts as heavy armour (armour save 5+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. Models attacking the wearer in close combat must pass a Strength test before rolling to hit for every Attack directed at the target (ie, roll equal to or less than its Strength on a D6, a 6 always fails). If the test is failed, the Attack is lost.

Artefact.Name: Dawn Armour
Artefact.Description: Counts as full plate armour (armour save 4+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. In addition the model can re-roll any failed armour save.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Tarnus
Artefact.Description: Counts as light armour (armour save 6+) which can be combined with other equipment normally. If the wearer fails his armour save, he may make a 5+ Ward save. Wizards can wear this armour and cast spells.

Artefact.Name: Shield of the Gorgon
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Can force one model in base contact to lose one Attack
Artefact.Description: This shield confers a 6+ armour save which can he combined with other equipment normally. The wearer can force one model in base contact to lose one Attack. In the case of models with different Attacks (eg, mounted models) the wearer chooses which Attack is lost. Special Attacks (like those of a Giant, impact hits and anything not included in the Attacks value on a model's profile) are not affected.

Artefact.Name: Armour of Meteoric Iron
Artefact.Description: This suit of armour gives the bearer a 1+ armour save which cannot be improved by any means.

Artefact.Name: Bronze Shield
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Ignores the first hit in the battle from shooting or close combat
Artefact.Description: This shield gives a 6+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally. Also, the bearer ignores the first hit in the battle suffered from shooting or close combat.

Artefact.Name: Helm of the Skaven Slayer
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Causes Fear in all models in a Skaven army
Artefact.Description: This helm confers a 6+ armour save which can be combined with other equipment normally (including normal armour and a shield). In addition, the wearer causes Fear in all models in a Skaven army.

Artefact.Name: Shroud of Magnus
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Totally immune to Dark, Skaven and Chaos magic, even if cast with Irresistible force
Artefact.Description: This item gives a 5+ Ward save. A model carrying the Shroud and his mount are totally immune to Dark, Skaven and Chaos magic, even if cast with Irresistible force. Note that the spell will not be dispelled and that other models in a unit the character is with will be affected normally.

Artefact.Name: Jade Amulet
Artefact.Description: The model may ignore the first wound it suffers.

Artefact.Name: Holy Relic
Artefact.Description: The Holy Relic gives its bearer a 4+ Ward save.

Artefact.Name: The White Cloak
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Immune to all cold-based spells attacks
Artefact.Description: This item gives a 5+ Ward save. Also, the wearer is immune to all cold-based spells attacks (White Dragon's breath, etc).

Artefact.Name: Sigil of Sigmar
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 dice to all Dispel rolls against enemy spells that would affect character or the unit he is with
Artefact.Description: The Sigil of Sigmar adds one extra dice to all Dispel rolls against enemy spells that would affect its wearer or the unit he is with.

Artefact.Name: The Crimson Amulet
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Automatically passes any characteristic tests he has to take (except Leadership tests)
Artefact.Description: This item gives a 6+ ward save. The wearer automatically passes any characteristic tests he has to take (except Leadership tests).

Artefact.Name: Grey Wand
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: +1 to the casting attempts
Artefact.Description: Gives +1 to the Casting attempts made by the Wizard.

Artefact.Name: Seal of Destruction
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once automatically dispel an enemy spell, on a 4+ the spell is removed from the caster's mind and he can no longer cast it
Artefact.Description: One use only. The seal has the same effect as a Dispel Scroll. In addition, roll a D6. On a result of 4+ the spell is removed from the caster's mind and he can no longer cast it. Spells cast from a bound item will only be removed on the result of a 6.

Artefact.Name: Rod of Power
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Can save up to three unused Power dice from the pool and store them, at the beginning of each successive magic phase roll a dice, if the result is equal or higher to the number of dice stored, add them to the Power dice pool
Artefact.Description: At the end of each Magic phase, you can save up to three dice from your Power dice pool and store them in the Rod. At the beginning of the next Magic phase (yours or the enemy's), roll a dice. If the result is equal or higher to the number of Power dice stored, add them to your pool, if the result is lower than the number of dice stored, they are lost.

Artefact.Name: Luckstone
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle, can re-roll all of the dice rolled to cast or dispel
Artefact.Description: One use only. Once per battle, the bearer can re-roll all of the dice rolled to cast or dispel a spell. This can effectively cancel a Miscast result, and cause Irresistible Force or a Miscast.

Artefact.Name: Crystal Ball
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: The enemy must always reveal all the 'secrets' involving all units that are within 12" of the Wizard at any time
Artefact.Description: The enemy must always reveal all the 'secrets' involving all units which are within 12" of the Wizard at any time. This includes which magic items are in the unit and who is carrying them, the presence of disguised Assassins, the number of Fanatics and everything else thai ihe player is not normally obliged to disclose to his opponent.

Artefact.Name: Wizard's Staff
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Use one more dice than he is normally allowed to when casting a spell
Artefact.Description: The Wizard's Staff allows the bearer to use one more dice from the Power dice pool than he is normally allowed to when casting a spell (eg. a level 1 Wizard will be able to use-up to three dice to cast spells).

Artefact.Name: Laurels of Victory
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Each wound caused will count as 2 Wounds when working out combat resolution
Artefact.Description: Each wound caused by a model wearing the Laurels of Victory (but not those caused by his mount) will count as 2 Wounds when working out combat resolution. Note that you do not actually cause double wounds on your victim!

Artefact.Name: Rod of Command
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Once per battle, instead rolling the dice for Break test, the player can declare he is using Rod of Command and the character (and his unit) automatically passing Break test
Artefact.Description: One use only. The character and the unit he is with will automatically pass the first Break test they have to take, regardless of modifiers and even if they would normally automatically fail their test (for example, losing a round of combat against an opponent thai outnumbers them and causes fear). If the player forgets to use it, even if he rolls and passes the lest, the item is slill used up. Note that this item cannot he used by a character in the turn he re-fused a challenge and who is hiding at the back of the unit (who would pay heed to such a coward!).

Artefact.Name: The Silver Horn
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, power level 5: if successfully cast, all fleeing friendly units on the battlefield will rally immediately, regardless of the number of models left
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level 5. The Silver Horn may cast its spell once per Empire Magic phase. The spell requires no Power dice to cast, all the power required is provided by the Horn itself. All friendly units that are fleeing anywhere on the battlefield will rally immediately.

Artefact.Name: The Orb of Thunder
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, power level 4: when the Orb of Thunder spell is in play, flying creatures on the battlefield cannot fly and must move on the ground at their normal Movement rate, remains in play
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level 4. The Orb of Thunder spell may be cast once per Empire Magic phase. The spell requires no Power dice to cast, all the power required is provided by the Orb Itself and the spell will last until dispelled. When the Orb of Thunder spell is in play, no flying creatures on the battlefield can use their ability to fly and will have to move on the ground at their normal Movement rate.

Artefact.Name: Aldred's Casket of Sorcery
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Bound spell, power level variable: at the end of each of his Movement phases, may automatically remove and capture one randomly determined spell from an enemy Wizard in base contact with him, he can cast the captured spell in his own Magic phase by releasing it from the casket
Artefact.Description: Bound spell, power level variable. At the end of each of his Movement phases, the bearer may automatically remove and capture one randomly determined spell from an enemy Wizard in base contact with him. The bearer can cast the captured spell in his own Magic phase by releasing it from the casket. The spell is then removed from the game. No Power dice are required to cast the spell. Any number of spells may be captured by the casket, and the bearer can cast each one once, either over several Magic phases or all at the same time if he prefers. The Power Level of the spell cast by the casket will be equivalent to the score normally needed to cast the spell.

Artefact.Name: Icon of Magnus
Artefact.SpecialRuleDescription: Not affected by enemies that cause fear, faced with an enemy that causes terror, the character and the unit he is with only suffer fear, not terror
Artefact.Description: Ihe character and the unit he is with are not affected by enemies that cause fear. Faced with an enemy that causes terror, the character and the unit he is with only suffer fear, not terror.
